title: BBC Local Live: Updates for Norfolk on Wednesday, 28 October 2015 - BBC News
summary: new safety measures have been brought in at wayland farms where a worker died .
a bomb disposal team has been called out to a property near great yarmouth to deal with `` potentially hazardous materials '' .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: goodbye from the norfolk live desk
text: that 's it from the team today.we hope you enjoyed our coverage .
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 tomorrow morning .
have a good evening .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: safety measures brought in after farm worker death
text: new safety measures have been brought in at a group of west norfolk farms following the death of a worker in march this year .
an inquest has heard 67-year-old peter buckle was loading a trailer by hand when a vehicle door swung closed , hitting his head and causing fatal injuries .
a `` stop and think '' campaign had been introduced at sites owned by wayland farms limited .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : mostly dry overnight , rain moving in late tomorrow
text: mostly dry with clear spells but turning cloudier and breezier later in the night , with temperatures falling to 7c ( 45f ) .
a dry and bright start tomorrow , but outbreaks of rain later in the day , with highs of up to 14c ( 57f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : new safety measures at farm where worker died bomb disposal team called to great yarmouth
text: the main news stories this evening :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: watch : go inside for a sneak peek of ikea pilot store
text: look east reporter alex dunlop has been shopping for work today , the lucky thing !
he 's been taking a look at ikea 's first uk order and collect store .
watch the full report tonight on bbc one from 18:30 .

documents.title: inquest hears farm machinery was faulty when man died
text: an inquest has heard a piece of farm machinery was faulty when a watton lorry driver died .
peter buckle , 67 , died after being hit on the head by a trailer door at wayland farms limited in gayton thorpe in march .
the inquest , which is continuing , was told he was loading rubbish by hand because a piece of equipment was broken .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: travel : severe delays around stoke ash on a140
text: there are severe problems on the a140 just over the border in suffolk .
the road 's partially blocked with queuing traffic in both directions around the major lane junction due to an accident .
more local travel at bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: nursing body says more training course places needed in east anglia
text: the number of nurses being trained in east anglia needs to significantly increase to meet patient care needs in coming years , according to the royal college of nursing ( rcn ) .
an rcn poll found up to 13 people are applying for each nurse training place at the university of east anglia .
the government recently added nurses to the government 's occupation shortage list , which means nurses from outside the eu will have their applications prioritised .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: bomb disposal team called to address near yarmouth
text: a bomb disposal team has been called out to a street near great yarmouth to deal with `` potentially hazardous materials '' at a property there .
norfolk police said officers were called to heron close in bradwell at about 07:30 , and a specialist team was in attendance .
the area has been sealed off but police say members of the public are not believed to be at risk or under threat .

documents.title: humpback whale sightings 'a real possibility ' , seawatch says
text: we 've been telling you about a dead minke whale which washed up at bacton this week , but experts think we 're well placed to spot live ones this autumn .
the seawatch foundation says recent trends and migration patterns suggest humpback whale sightings off norfolk are a distinct possibility this november .
if you 're planning to go whale spotting do send us any especially if you 're lucky enough to capture a shot as dramatic as the one above .
author: Rob Sykes
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: another one about the horse who walked into the bar
text: and it 's still not a joke !
khan is a regular at a south norfolk pub , the banham barrel .
apparently he loves to eat scampi fries at the bar .
more photos of the pub regular can be seen on bbc radio norfolk 's facebook page .
author: Rebecca Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: fire crews called to smoke-logged property in attleborough
text: fire crews were called to a smoke-logged building in attleborough yesterday afternoon .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: warning over 'world cup lottery ' scam
text: letters sent to homes in the sprowsten area claiming to be from `` the international fifa world cup online lottery in australia '' should not be believed , police said .
they 're part of a scam and say people have won large amounts of money to try to get them to pass their bank details on .
`` i would urge the public to be vigilant about this type of fraud and should you receive such a letter , do not respond , '' said sgt richard bedder from norfolk police .

documents.title: level crossing problem causes norwich to cambridge train delays
text: a problem with a level crossing is causing delays to services between norwich and cambridge , rail operator great anglia says .
# thetford-due to a problem with a level crossing near thetford-harling road , norwich-cambridge trains may be delayed up to 10 mins .
km
@ twitterid good afternoon
@ twitterid good afternoon katie .
rs

documents.title: weather : rain gradually easing this afternoon
text: the rain will eventually clear by the end of the day , although remaining cloudy .
temperatures reaching 14c ( 57f ) .
weatherhas more local details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : a11 in besthorpe blocked after crash
text: the a11 southbound is blocked in besthorpe before the b1077 ellingham road junction because of an accident involving a car and a tractor .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: tattoo demand rises in uk 's second-most inked city
text: the owner of a norwich tattoo shop says he is not surprised by a poll which revealed the city has the second-highest number of people with tattoos in the uk .
aaron hardingham of stryke studios said demand had `` definitely gone up in the last three-and-a-half-years we 've been here '' .
the research was produced by motorbike insurance broker carole nash , which said it wanted to show tattoos are now a mainstream form of body art .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: headlines : views sought on lynx re-introduction plan
text: our top story this lunchtime :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: we 're not joking - horse opens new bar at fakenham races
text: have you heard the one about the horse that goes into a bar ?
eleven times winner cool roxy officially opened the new bar at fakenham racecourse earlier .
cool roxy strutting his stuff at the official owners & trainers bar opening !
# fakenhamraces great to have him back !
@ twitterid we all had a great day , roxy really enjoyed racing there and loved being the star attraction once again , many thanks to all : )
thank you so much for being a part of today @ twitterid we were thrilled to have you as always
@ twitterid love your new facilities great racecourse
thank you @ twitterid i am glad you enjoy them .

documents.title: council says it followed national code on support for deaf children
text: a national code of practice lays behind norfolk county council 's policy for deaf children in need of extra help in education .
the authority has been responding to calls by a mother from north wootton , who told bbc radio norfolk her three-year-old 's education could suffer unless he gets more specialist help at pre-school .
we 've followed the national code of practice by offering 15 hours a week support for xavier while he is attending his nationally funded 15 hours a week of pre-school .
the number of hours of support is set to increase to 27.5 hours a week when he starts school next september . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: inquest opens and adjourns into norwich car park death
text: an inquest has opened into the death of a man whose body was found at a multi-storey car park in norwich on sunday .
robert geeson , who was 66 and lived in hellesdon , was found at anglia square in the early hours of the morning .
his injuries were said to be from a fall from a height .
the inquest has been adjourned until march .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: your six little piggies went to market
text: we could n't resist this collection of cheeky looking piglets captured by clive whitwood in northwold , near downham market .
your norfolk wildlife are always welcome especially the really cute ones , perfect for that 'ahhh ' moment in our busy days .
send them to us by email , or as a post to our facebook page with just a few details of where the was taken .

documents.title: ikea : more details about new norwich pilot store revealed
text: i do n't often get a chance to `` go shopping '' while i 'm at work .
but this morning i 'm with the media pack being given a briefing about the `` new concept '' ikea store opening on norwich 's sweetbriar retail park in november .
of the 32 employees at the new `` order and collect '' site - 30 have been recruited locally .
there 's no need to all rush at once - the company tells me there wo n't be any discount offers on its first day of opening on monday .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: norfolk food bank sees demand continuing to rise
text: volunteers at a food bank in waveney say demand for their services is still increasing .
it comes as a new report by an independent commission says the government lacks a strategy to tackle hunger in britain .
we give out about a tonne of food a month to people who 've been given a voucher by a care professional i do n't know how we 've got to this point but somehow or other something 's gone wrong . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: uea students to protest over planned cuts to maintenance grants
text: students from the university of east anglia are to carry out a campus protest about government plans to cut maintenance grants .
the student 's union fear the plans to see all existing grant funding converted into loans , would affect the poorest students , forcing them to take on more debt .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: headlines : uea protest over plans to axe maintenance grants local food bank says demand is rising
text: the main news stories so far :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: ikea : first look at new style store being piloted in norwich
text: the wait is nearly over for ikea fans in norfolk .
store manager , roger cooper is giving the media a sneak preview of the first order and collect store in the uk at the moment .
the store opens to the public on 2 november i 'm fairly sure i wo n't need my defence correspondent flak jacket on this occasion , but then again christmas rush and all that !
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: recruitment drive for town pastors in dereham
text: dereham town pastors are currently seeking local christians to become town pastors and prayer pastors and begin a training programme in january 2016 .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: on the back page : city manager feels for players after penalty shoot-out heartbreak
text: 'we should have won it '' neil tells the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: your 'golden carpet ' in chapelfield gardens
text: lots of people have been enjoy kicking their way through the autumn leaves at the moment we captured this shot in norwich 's chapelfield gardens .
we 'd love to see your of the county in autumn .
send them to us by email , or as a post to our facebook page .
the norfolk countryside photos group also has some wonderful images of `` red october '' .

documents.title: replacement rail services for sunday between norwich and cambridge
text: there are alterations to services on abellio greater anglia this weekend :
sun : norwich-cambridge services will operate as rail replacement until 20.00 between ely & cambridge gk

documents.title: society backs norfolk mother 's calls for early support for deaf children
text: the national deaf children 's society says it 's vital children get early support to help their educational progress .

the society is backing norfolk mother , katie raworth , who says , her three-year-old-son xavier , is struggling , because he does n't have a signing assistant with him for the whole of his time at nursery .
deafness is not a learning disability , and there 's no reason why deaf children should n't fail to achieve as well as another child it 's really important the support is there for them . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: travel news : bus cancellations to and from poringland
text: there are some cancellations to anglian bus services this afternoon :

documents.title: body art : norwich is the second most tattooed city in the uk
text: it seems the people of norwich love a bit body art with the city the second highest `` most tattooed '' in the uk with 41 % of people wearing some ink , according to the i100 from the independent .
the research found that lettering was the favoured tattoo choice in the city .
are you sporting some body art ?
we 'd love to see your ( suitable for a family audience ) , share them with us on email , or facebook .
let us know why you got the artwork and why it 's important to you .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: on the front page : brave mattie is honoured
text: brave mattie is honoured , reports the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: views sought on reintroduction of the lynx cat to norfolk
text: farmers and landowners are being asked for their views on a proposal to bring back lynx to parts of england and scotland .
the lynx uk trust has suggested trial reintroductions to norfolk , northumberland , cumbria aberdeenshire and argyll .
the national farmers union has previously raised concerns , while other organisations , have said lynx could form an important part in `` rewilding '' areas of the uk .
what do you think ?
email us with your thoughts .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: sporting back page : brave city beaten in dramatic quarter-final shoot out
text: norwich city 's capital one cup defeat leads the edp back page today :

documents.title: football : missed chances crucial in canary cup defeat - holt
text: missed chances were crucial in the canaries ' capital one cup defeat at everton , former norwich city striker grant holt told bbc radio norfolk 's canary call .
`` no one really getting chances finished things off , lewis grabban 's was the biggest , if he 'd put that in that would have been it .
`` they worked and worked , it was a good performance in terms of effort , but quality was lacking from both sides , '' he said .
author: Richard Hancock
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: on the front page : cuts will change policing us airmen prepare for poignant flight home
text: stories making the eastern daily press front page today :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: norwich ikea : more details unveiled today
text: if you love ikea then we 've just the thing for you a little later as we 've been invited to take a sneak preview of their new norwich store .
look east reporter , alex dunlop is going to a media only event this morning and will hopefully have more details about the company 's first click and collect shop .
the new format is considerably smaller than a traditional ikea outlet .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: travel : disruption on the b1436 in both directions at a140 junction
text: there 's slow traffic in both directions between the a140 norwich road junction and the a149 north walsham road junction due to an overturned car .
the b1436 thorpe market road in roughton is closed .
get more local updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: more help needed for deaf pre-school children
text: the mother of a deaf three-year-old boy says his future education could suffer unless he gets more specialist help while at pre-school .
xavier , from north wootton , is entitled to 15 hours hearing assistance each week , but he 's at pre-school for 24 hours .
his mother , katie raworth , says he 's struggling to keep up in the nine hours he 's left without a signing support worker .
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: football : norwich boss sympathetic with penalty-miss players
text: norwich city manager alex neil says he felt for webs hoolahan and nathan redmond , who missed their spot-kicks , as the canaries went out of the capital one cup with a defeat on penalties at everton last night .
`` you know the disappointment they 're going to feel afterwards , and because of how well they performed they deserved to go through .
`` it 's disappointing for them but it happens , we need to dust ourselves down and continue playing like that , '' he said .
author: Richard Hancock
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy with rain , but brighter later
text: cloudy with outbreaks of rain , some heavy at times but this will die away towards the evening .
top temperature 14c ( 57f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : deaf boy 's mother calling for more pre-school support demand is rising for help from foodbanks

documents.title: good morning and welcome to local live for norfolk
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page , where we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county until 18:00 .
any comments , or stories you 'd like to share please email , tweet or facebook us .
news and weather updates for this morning coming up shortly .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live
